call_id_0
0 I need help planning my Social Security benefits for my survivors.
0 Are you currently planning for your future?
0 Yes, I am.
0 you should think about what your family would need if you die now. Social Security can help your family if you have earned enough credits through your work.
1 Could the benefits received by my family be affected if my widow receives a pension based on work?
1 If it not covered by Social Security, her benefits as a survivor may be affected.
2 and what about my ex-wife. Would the benefits she'd receive affect the amount my widow gets?
2 It won't, the benefits your ex-wife would receive won't affect the benefits the rest of your survivors would receive.
3 And for my parents, what benefits can they receive?
3 They can get the survivor benefits if you provide at least half of your parents' support and they are not eligible for retirement benefits higher than the benefit they would get as survivors from your record.
4 About my ex-wife, would she stop receiving the survivor benefit if she remarries after my death?
4 She won't if she remarries after turning 60 (50 if disabled).

0 I want to know when I should apply for disability benefits
0 You should apply for disability benefits as soon as you become disabled
0 Are you ready to apply for disability benefits?
0 no, not yet but maybe soon. so can I call or walk in somewhere to do this other than online?
0 yes there are other ways to apply. Will you need any help? are you deaf or hard of hearing?
0 yes,I am deaf
0 when you are ready to apply you can call us at TTY  1-800-325-0778 , or Call or visit your local Social Security office .
1 what are some of the kinds of things you will ask for when I apply?
1 Your Social Security number and proof of your age ; Names , addresses , and phone numbers of doctors , caseworkers , hospitals , and clinics that took care of you and the dates of your visits; Names and dosages of all the medications you are taking
2 and all I do is give that info and I get it for sure or what?
2 There is a possibility that after we review your application and the information you provided, we may decide you do not meet the qualifications for disability benefits .
2 would you like to know what to do in case you are denied?
2 yes please
2 If you don't qualify you may ask us to look at your application again. You will receive a notice from us if you don't qualify  and it will explain how to appeal our decision and the time period in which you must make the request .
call_id_2
0 I want a apply for a corrected card for a U.S. born adult.
0 Have you legally changed your name?
0 I have, yes.
0 Then the first you need to do is to inform Social Security so that they can give you a corrected card.
1 What if I haven't established my citizenship yet?
1 You can give as proof of your U.S. citizenship documents like your U.S. birth certificate or your U.S. passport.
1 What if I don't have some of the required documents?
1 We'll ask you for any other document that can identify you correctly. Like your employee Id card.
1 What should I do to change my name on my Social Security card?
1 You'll have to provide evidence of your legal name change. You can use documents like your marriage document to prove this.
1 Can I muse an expired document as proof of identity?
1 no, the documents you use must be current, not expired.
2 and photocopies of the original documents?
2 No, photocopies are not accepted either.

1 For that purpose, please make use of the detailed calculator.

1 That's correct. The calculator will figure out that taking the benefit as if your birthday was in the previous year.
1 A last thing, please. What do i need to enter in the calculator?
1 That's simple. You only need to enter all your past earnings. If you need to find that out, just check your online account.
call_id_5
0 What do the documents need to be about in order to get my social security card?
0 The documents all pertain to proving your U.S. citizenship.
0 Are you a U.S. citizen?
0 Yes, I am a U.S. citizen. If I don't have the right documents are there other avenues to take?
0 Yes, we can consider other documents such as your passport or documents issued by the DHS that can prove your age.
1 Can you get a social security card for a foreign born U.S. citizen?
1 Yes, as long as you comply with the regulations and have the right documentation, you can apply for a social security card.
2 Can I show other documents if I don't have the ones requested?
2 Yes, we will ask to see other documentation that is current and that can identify you by name, date of birth, and a recent photo.
2 If I have lived in the U.S what other information might you ask for?
2 We may ask for tax records or for information about the school that you attended.
3 Are you able to accept photocopied documents?
3 No, we can only accept original documents that are current.
call_id_6
0 I need a Social Security card or number for my daughter
0 Okay, it is important that we verify a birth record for all U.S . born applicants who apply for an original Social Security number. Exceptions are made for parents who apply for a baby's Social Security number at the hospital when the baby is born
0 Did you need to know how we verify birth records?
0 yeah, what do I do to verify?
1 What else will I need besides birth records? do we need to show proof of identity?
1 We will need evidence that shows the child continues to exist beyond the date of birth . We only accept certain documents as proof of your child 's identity. Documents must show your child's name , identifying information such as ,age , date of birth , or parents ' names and preferably a recent photograph. We may accept a non - photo ID  document if it has enough information to identify the child such as the child 's name and age , date of birth, or parents ' names .
1 What if we don't have those things like ID or passport?
1 You could use a state issued non - driver 's identification card or an adoption decree
1 OK, what if we lived in Mexico for some time? will you accept papers from there?
1 If your child lived outside the United States for an extended period , you could use a current or previous passport ,school and/or employment records ,and any other record that would show long - term residence outside the U.S. to show that your child does not have a Social Security number and needs one.
1 and do I need a birth certificate?
1 If you have or can get a U.S .- State - Issued birth certificate that recorded his or her birth before age 5 then you must submit it
2 and will all this help with being able to claim an adopted kid for tax reasons?
2 If you want to claim your child for tax purposes while the adoption is still pending , contact the Internal Revenue Service for Form W-7A , Application for Taxpayer Identification Number for Pending U.S. Adoptions .

call_id_9
0 What are the original documents needed for getting an original social security card for a foreign-born U.S. citizen adopted child?.
0 The first thing you'll need to do is to prove your child's citizenship.
0 Do you happen to have lost the child's certificate and are unable to get another one within 10 days?
0 I haven't lost the child's birth certificate.
0 But my child lived outside the United States for quite some time.
0 In that case, you'll need to provide a document that proves that your child lived in another country and does not have a social security number. You could use records like the child's school records or employment records.
1 Is it possible to get him a number assigned before the adoption process is completed?
1 It is possible, yes. In some cases, we do assign a number before the adoption process is completed but you may want to wait.
2 What other documents can I use as proof that my kid decided outside the US for a long time?
2 apart from the ones mentioned before, any document that shows long-term residence in another country would be enough.
2 And what documents can I use to prove my identity?
2 Good documents to use as proof of identity are your U.S. driver's license or a state-issued non-driver identification card.

call_id_18
0 How do I know when I should apply for Medicare?
0 Medicare typically starts when you turn 65 years old.
0 Have you reached 65 but decided to delay your benefits?
0 Yes, I have decided to delay receiving my benefits, is there someone I should contact about this?
0 Yes, you would need to contact Social Security at least 3 months before you turn 65 to check about applying for Medicare.
0 What happens if I need Medicare but I didn't sign up?
0 If you didn't sign up on time, you benefits may be delayed and there may be a higher cost associated with it.
0 Do I still need to look into getting Medicare even I have health insurance through my employer?
0 Yes, you should still check to see if you should sign up with Medicare because once you turn 65, some health insurance plans automatically change.
0 Does this apply if you have health insurance as part of a severance package?
0 Yes, even if you receive health insurance through severage, you should still look into Medicare.
0 Can I file for only one benefit?
0 No, you will be filing for all retirement or spousal benefits.

call_id_74
0 I wanted to know if only I can see the information on my mySocial Security account. I'm very concerned about my privacy.
0 Yes. Social Security is dedicated to protecting the information and resources entrusted to us, including your personal information and investment. For your protection, you're the only one who can create your personal my Social Security account for your own exclusive use. No one can create or use an account on your behalf, even with written permission.
0 Are you concerned about your protection?
0 No, I trust you. It's alright.
0 But since we already talk about my privacy, I'm not allowed to share my account with someone else, right?
0 Of course. Don't share the use of your account with anyone else under any circumstances, as unauthorized use of this service is a misrepresentation of your identity to the federal government and could subject you to criminal or civil penalties, or both.
1 Well, I ran into some issues with creating an account. You see, I have a security freeze on my credit report. Can I still create an account?
1 Yes, you can create a my Social Security account online after lifting the security freeze or fraud alert.
2 I've chosen to confirm my email address yesterday, today I found the mail with the link but it doesn't seem to work. Any advice?
2 Of course. You have to confirm your email address or phone number by entering a one-time security code within 10 minutes of receiving it in order to help keep your personal information safe.
3 Can you help me with creating an account and handling my security freeze?
3 Gladly. Just contact our Identity Services Provider and request that they temporarily lift your security freeze or fraud alert.
3 And after that, will you reinstate the freeze?
3 Yes, we will reinstate the security freeze or fraud alert with the Identity Services Provider if needed.

0 How can I ensure that I keep receiving my disability benefits?
0 normally, you will continue to receive the disability benefits for as long as you are disabled.
0 Is there any exceptions?
0 yes, under certain circumstances you could stop receiving the benefits. For example, if your health improves to the point that you are no longer considered disabled or you can go back to work.
1 How often would social security review my case to check up on my condition?
1 If your condition is expected to improve then your case will normally be reviewed within 6 to 18 months after your benefits start.
2 What other things can cause benefits to stop?
2 There are a couple of things that can make us decide that you are no longer disabled, that is, if you work at a level we consider substantial, or if we decide that your medical condition has improved to the point that you are no longer disabled.
3 what if the medical condition is not expected to prove, how often would you review my case?
3 The other cases are if we consider that is possible for your condition to improve, and if we do not expect your condition to improve. For the first one, your case will be reviewed no sooner than three years, and for the second one, your case will normally be reviewed no sooner than seven years.

call_id_172
0 There are several things that I need explained about medicare premiums. Perhaps you can help me?
0 Of course. The law requires an adjustment to your monthly Medicare Part B medical insurance and Medicare prescription drug coverage premiums. This affects less than five percent of people with Medicare. Most people don t pay higher premiums.
1 What role does my tax return play in this?
1 Do you want to know how we determine your 2020 income-related monthly adjustment amounts?
1 Sure. Go ahead.
1 We use your most recent federal tax return the IRS provides to us. Generally, his information is from a tax return filed in 2019 for tax year 2018. Sometimes, the IRS only provides information from a return filed in 2018 for tax year 2017.
1 What if I amended my tax return?
1 In that case you should let us know. We count and it changes the income to determine the income-related monthly adjustment amounts your MAGI.
1 *doesn't make sense*
1 *doesn't make sense*
2 What would influence my income-related monthly adjustment amount?
2 It would change, for example, if you or your spouse stopped working or reduced your work hours.
call_id_173
0 what can you tell me about Medicare Premiums: Rules For Higher-Income Beneficiaries
0 The law requires an adjustment to your monthly Medicare Part B medical insurance and Medicare prescription drug coverage premiums . This affects less than five percent of people with Medicare . Most people don t pay higher premiums
1 How Social Security Determines I Have a Higher Premium
1 Social Security uses the most recent federal tax return the IRS provides to us .
1 you must pay higher premiums
1 yes
1 we use a sliding scale to calculate the adjustments , based on your modified adjusted gross income MAGI . Your MAGI is your total adjusted gross income and tax - exempt interest income .
2  If I re a higher - income beneficiary with Medicare prescription drug coverage
2 you ll pay monthly premiums plus an additional amount , which is based on what you report to the IRS . Because individual plan premiums vary , the law specifies that the amount is determined using a base premium .
3 if I income isn t greater than the limits described above
3  this law does not apply to you
4  If I have higher income
4 you ll pay an additional premium amount for Medicare Part B and Medicare prescription drug coverage . We call the additional amount the income - related monthly adjustment amount

0 You must earn at least 40 Social Security credits to qualify for Social Security benefits . You earn Social Security credits when you work and pay Social Security taxes
1 How Credits Are Earned?
1 you work and pay Social Security taxes?
1 not
2 I need more information about the amount of credits
2 The number of credits does not affect the amount of benefits you receive .  It only determines if you are eligible or not . You do not get extra benefits for earning more than the minimum number of credits
3 if i work and pay Social Security taxes
3 you earn up to a maximum of four credits per year

call_id_177
0 I have some questions regarding my social security credits and could use some help with that.
0 Of course. You must earn at least 40 Social Security credits to qualify for Social Security benefits. You earn Social Security credits when you work and pay Social Security taxes.
0 Wait, does this mean I get more money if I have more credits?
0 The number of credits does not affect the amount of benefits you receive.
0 So I don't get more if I have more credits?
0 No, credits only determine if you are eligible or not. You do not get extra benefits for earning more than the minimum number of credits.
1 Alright, now I understand. How many credits would I need for survivor benefits?
1 The number of credits needed for family members to be eligible for survivors benefits depends on your age when you die. The younger you are,  the fewer credits needed.
1 Are you already receiving retirement or disability benefits?
1 No, I'm not.
2 I'm also statutorily blind, how does that affect my work test?
2 You must only meet the duration of work test.

call_id_200
0 Hi there, I am looking for information regarding the Affordable Care Act and my VA health coverage
0 The Affordable Care Act is also known as the health care law. It was created to increase access for citizens to health care coverage, to control health care costs and also to improve health care quality and care coordination
1 If I don't have health insurance, do I have any penalties to pay?
1 This part of the law was changed by Congress, for plans that were starting in 2019. The payment referred to as the individual shared responsibility payment no longer applies in plan year 2019, for which you will be filing taxes in April 2020
2 How do I get health care coverage for 2019 if I am not signed up for VA health care or the Department of Defense health care program?
2 You may still be able to get health care coverage through the Health Insurance Marketplace. Enrolment for this for 2019 is now over however. You can still enrol or change plans if you have had certain life changes or if you qualify for free or low-cost coverage through Medicaid or the Children's Health Insurance Program CHIP
3 Does my VA health care meet the ACA's minimum essential coverage requirement for 2018?
3 If you were signed up for one of the designated programs listed on the website, your health coverage meets the minimum requirement for 2018
3 What are these designated health care programs?
3 Yes, I am
3 In that case, you don't have to pay any fee when you file your 2018 taxes and to qualify, you must be enrolled on one the programs that are listed on the website
4 Is there a penalty applicable if I don't have health insurance?
4 Until the end of 2018, the ACA required that all US taxpayers had to have health insurance that met a minimum standard. Some taxpayers are eligible for exemptions from this due to certain life events, financial status or other factors. If you had affordable health care options open to you and you chose not to avail of health insurance, then you would have to pay a fee when filing your taxes
4 What happens if I didn't have health coverage in 2018 or have an exemption?
4 In this instance, you may still have to pay a fee to file your taxes in April 2019. To find out more, I will refer you to HealthCare.gov to find out more about exemptions

5 How is it possible for me to know when my hearing is scheduled?
5 The Board of Veterans Appeals schedules hearing in docket order in which they receive their requests and you will receive the notice in the mail 30 days before your hearing is scheduled.
6 What if I change my mind about wanting a hearing?
6 You would write to the Board to withdraw your hearing request and it will not speed up your appeal unless you also switch to the Direct Review appeal option.

call_id_234
0 Hello I need information about what to expect at my Board hearing
1 Do you want to know specifically what will happen to your audience?
1 do not
2 Do you want to know when the judge will make a decision on your appeal?
2 Yes
2 Your hearing will be transcribed and added to your appeal file. You will be asked if you want a copy of the transcript for your personal records. The judge will review the hearing and other evidence in your appeal file before making a decision.
2 Do you know how long you can present new evidence to your case?
2 do not
2 Do you have new evidence to present?
2 Yes
2 Good in the event that you have new evidence to present, it will take 90 days. If you don't have new evidence to present, you can waive the 90-day period that is automatically added to your appeal. Some Veterans Service Organizations will ask for time to present additional arguments in support of your case, so please contact your representative first if you are considering waiving this time period.
3 ok, and can I reschedule or withdraw my Board hearing request?
4 you want to know What if you need to reschedule your audience?
4 Yes
4 You must send a written request to the Veterans Appeals Board with good reason to reschedule your hearing at least 2 weeks before your hearing. Include your name, the VA file number for your appeal, and the reason you need a new hearing date. Submit your request in writing to the Board.

3 Yes, you have 90 days after the day of your hearing to submit new evidence for the judges review
4 what if I don't want to use the board hearing with the judge but would rather use another option to appeal, will I have to reschedule?
4 You will keep the same docket date and your appeal will be decided at the same time as other appeals with the same date. However, the time it takes to get a decision is different on each appeal option.
4 what do I do if I don't want to have any kind of hearing at all?
4 You can write to the Board to withdraw your hearing request. This wont speed up your appeal unless you also switch to the Direct Review appeal option, which can only be done at certain times.

call_id_244
0 Hello I need information about the VA duty to help
0 Of course I would love to help you. VA's duty to help requires VA to help you obtain evidence, such as medical records, that is necessary to support your case. VA s The duty to help applies during your initial claim and if you file a supplemental claim.
0 What happens if I request a Higher Level Review or a Board Appeal?
0 The duty to help does not apply. However, the reviewer or judge will review whether VA fulfilled its duty to assist during your initial or supplemental claim.
1 But I have a particular circumstance, in my case I do not agree with a VA decision that I received in January 2019, what can I do in that case?
1 If you disagree with a VA decision you received before February 19, 2019, you can opt for the modernized review system after receiving a VA Statement from the SOC on the case or a Supplemental Statement from the SSOC on the case.
2 What if I want to choose a different review option after I have submitted a form?
2 let me ask you, have you submitted a form expressing your desire to change your review option?
2 no I haven't sent it

3 By submitting your application on time, you will ensure that you receive the maximum benefit if your case is granted. Check the deadline for each review option and submit your request before that date

0 Of course. At VA, we take a team approach to health care with you at the center. Research shows this kind of approach leads to better quality care, more satisfied patients, and fewer hospital visits.

1 Your team will include a primary care provider your main doctor, nurse practitioner, or physician's assistant, a clinical pharmacist, a pharmacist who works with you and your primary care provider to make sure you're taking the medicines that are right for you and your overall health.

1 You can take classes at more than one school under the GI Bill as long as the classes at both schools count toward your degree, and the school granting your degree considers the classes at the second school to be required in order to get your degree.

3 And one final question: how are my payments calculated?
3 We decide your payment amounts based on the number of classes you go to and the hours spent in those classes. For most undergraduate degrees a college considers 12 or more hours full time.

3 How do I know if I served under an eligible wartime period?
3 [31] Under current law ,s [32] we recognize the following wartime periods to decide eligibility for VA pension benefits :s   [33] Mexican Border period May 9 , 1916 , to April 5 , 1917 , for Veterans who served in Mexico , on its borders , or in adjacent waters
3 what other wartime periods do you recognize ?
3  [34] World War I April 6 , 1917 , to November 11 , 1918   [35] World War II December 7 , 1941 , to December 31 , 1946   [36] Korean conflict June 27 , 1950 , to January 31 , 1955   [37] Vietnam War era (February 28, 1961, to May 7, 1975, for Veterans who served in the Republic of Vietnam during that period.   [38] August 5, 1964, to May 7, 1975, for Veterans who served outside the Republic of Vietnam.)   [39] Gulf War August 2 , 1990 , through a future date to be set by law or presidential proclamation

5 the points are added in the date the violation occured and not the date you are found guilty.

0 How do I get a licence to drive a taxi?
0 In New York State you must be 18 years of age and must have a class A CDL, Class B CDL, Class  C CDL or Class E driver license.
0 I am 18 years old.  How do I get a real ID?
0 Take required documents to the DMV.
0 Ok how do I get a Class E if I have a Class C?
0 You will complete the application, present your proof of identity and surrender your class C license and apply and pay for a Class E.
0 What is the fee?
0 The fee is based on the expiration date of your current driver license and we can not calculate that fee until you apply.
1 Do I have to take any test?
1 You have to take the vision test or prove that you meet our vision requirement.
2 Why do I need a REAL ID?
2 If you plan on traveling you will be required to have it.
3 Is a license required to become a taxi driver?
3 Yes, you must have a driver license that is either a Class A commercial driver license CDL, Class B CDL or one of two others.
4 If I don't get a real ID now will I have to later?
4 Yes, if you plan on traveling you will be required to have a REAL ID.

1 The cost of exchanging a plate before the due date is $3.75 additional fee.
2 Can I receive the same plate number if I request an Empire Gold plate?
2 Yes, you can get new Empire Gold plates and keep your number to your personalized plate when you renew your registration.
2 IDo you want Empire Gold plates but your current personalized plates are not up for renewal?
2 No, not at this time.
3 Can i keep my current plates and not get Empire Gold plates when i am up for renewal?
3 You actually can keep your current plates or order the Empire Gold plates when up for renewal.
4 Is there a topic I can look up online?
4 Yes, you can look online under the topic Registration.
5 What should i do with my old plates when i get my new Empire Gold plates?
5 You should use a permanent ink marker to cross out the plate number or otherwise deface the plates before you recycle your old plates.

0 Were you unable to keep your insurance while on active duty?
0 yes, it just wasn't on my mind and I don't get notices and anything like that while deployed
0 DMV has a procedure in place to exempt you from administrative actions upon your return. You must provide a notarized statement that the vehicle was not used during the time in question, a copy of your military ID, proof of current insurance  or surrender of plates, and signed and dated copies of deployment and return papers, or DD-214. You can present these documents at any DMV office , or mail them to us.

1 You can renew your license if it was valid at any time during your military service. Active military personnel will have to show proof of date of entry into military service
2 is anything being done to help us when this happens?
2 Yes, pursuant to Executive Order No. 2 by Governor Andrew M. Cuomo, all licenses and registrations for New York State military personnel returning from active military duty relating to the war on terrorism and military action in Iraq will automatically be extended.
3 how much time do I have to renew my license after it expired?
3 Discharged or separated military personnel may renew an expired NY State license up to two years after the extended expiration. No more than 30 months may have passed since discharge

5 What is a CDL Driving Record Summary?
5  Commercial CDL abstracts show expanded driver history information that is not available on a Standard Driving Record

call_id_438
0 Yes I need to obtain an in-depth record of my driving history for a new job, can you tell me how to proceed please.
1 Do you mean a CDL driving record abstract?
1 Oh, is that what it's called? Then I guess that's it.
1 Commercial CDL abstracts show expanded driver history information that is not available on a Standard Driving Record. The information included are the following: convictions, suspensions, revocations and other licensing actions, Medical Certification Status information and Self- Certification information.
2 I tried to do it online but ran into a technical glitch, is there some other way to do it?
2 Certainly, you can mail a Request for Certified CDL Abstract PDF MV-CDL form along with the $10 fee to the DMV to the address provided on the form, or have your employer order your CDL driving record abstract through LENS.
3 Is this abstract official? Like I won't need anything else to prove this information?
3 Yes it is a certified DMV record including a certification statement and the signature of the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles, as well as a security watermark.
4 What do I enter in a search for more information?
4 The topic 'DMV Records' would be useful for you.
5 The mail in option sounds like it would be long. If I find a way to do it online what do I need to create an account?
5 You will need a New York State license, permit or non - driver ID or yourNew York State license.

call_id_461
0 I have a few questions about certification requirements for obtaining a CDL.
0 Do you have a CDL permit issued by a NY State DMV?
0 Yes, I do.
0 In your case, you will need to certify the type of driving you do anytime you perform a license transaction except for an address change or getting a duplicate license. You will also be required to choose one driving type from the four federal driving types.
1 Okay. What if my driving type will be NA?
1 You will need to send in a photocopy of your USDOT Medical Examiner's Certificate to the Medical Certification Unit. This must be done before the expiration date on your USDOT Medical Examiner's Certificate.
2 Can I get a HAZMAT endorsement for my selected driving type?
2 Yes, you can have a HAZMAT endorsement with driving types NI and NA.
3 What happens if I don't keep my information updated with the DMV?
3 This could result in losing your commercial driving privileges.
4 How do I get a USDOT Medical Examiner's Certificate?
4 You can obtain a USDOT Medical Examiner's Certificate by receiving a USDOT physical performed by a medical examiner. Be sure to choose a medical examiner that is listed on the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration's FMCSA National Registry.
5 How do I know if the Medical Certificate is on my record or not?
5 You can monitor your CLP/CDL medical certification status by subscribing to text and email notifications online at MyDMV.

call_id_467
0 I want to become a driving school instructor and need to know what tests are involved in the process.
0 First, you will need to pass a vision test similar to the one you need to complete in order to qualify or renew your driver license. This can be conducted at the DMV or you can have your eye doctor/physician conduct the test for you and have him/her complete the Vision Test Report.
0 Are you aware of what will happen if you do not pass all the required tests?
0 Yes, I know.
0 Okay. In addition to submitting a new application, you will be charged a $10 fee.
1 What is required to become a driving school instructor?
1 You must have a New York driver license that has been valid for at least 2 years in the class of vehicle that you intend to teach in. You must also have an acceptable driving record and your license cannot be suspended or revoked in the last 2 years.
2 What is the name of the form that my eye doctor needs to fill out for the vision test?
2 It's called the Vision Test Report form MV-619.
3 Does my license have to be valid for 2 years since completing the application or after I get my instructor license?
3 Your license must be valid for at least 2 years after you complete the application.
4 What if I have a driver license that was issued in another state?
4 When you complete your application, you will need to include a certified copy of your driving record from the state agency that issued your driver license.
5 What is a driving school instructor expected to do?
5 Once you become a certified driving school instructor, you will be teaching individuals how to drive a vehicle at a licensed driving school.
call_id_468
0 What can you tell me about registering a snowmobile?
0 Is your snowmobile registered in your home state?
0 No, currently not.
1 Can you suggest a topic to me?
1 Registration.
2 That brings me to an issue with my registration. Can I use an abbreviation of my street name? The space on the form is too narrow.
2 Yes, you can abbreviate or omit the street type if the street name is a word which has an accepted abbreviation.
2 Why can't I enter my complete address on the NY registration for my snowmobile from Alabama?
2 The snowmobile registration system only allows for 20 characters for the street address and 14 characters for the city.
2 But what if my street address or city name is too long to fit in the field?
2 Please follow our guidelines in the order presented until the information fits within the field, use numbers digits instead of words, for the house number, for example.
3 And how old do I need to be to register a vehicle in NY?
3 You must be at least 16 years old to register a vehicle in New York except a boat or ATV. A NY State Driver License, Learner Permit, or non-driver ID card that is current or not expired for more than 2 years can serve as proof of both identity and age.
call_id_469
0 I just received a Notice of Registration Suspension and need to know if I have to attend the hearing.
0 Have you read the Notice of Registration Suspension?
0 Yes, I received it yesterday.
0 You can request an in-person DMV hearing or request a hearing by affidavit, which is a hearing on paper. This is up to you. Your Notice of Registration provides instructions about how to submit the affidavit to DMV.
0 So, if I submit the affidavit, I don't have to attend the hearing?
0 Yes, that is correct.
0 What if I don't request a hearing or send an affidavit?
0 The DMV will then suspend your registration immediately.
1 How can I dispute these allegations that I failed to pay toll fees?
1 You will need to contact the tolling authority that is listed on your Notice of Registration Suspension.
2 Does the tolling authority issue toll violations?
2 Yes, the tolling authority is responsible for toll violations. The tolling authority includes the New York State Thruway Authority , the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority MTA Bridges and Tunnels and the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
3 Can I call the tolling authority?
3 Yes, you can.

call_id_471
0 Tell me about how to pay suspension termination fee
0 A suspension means your driver license or privilege to drive is taken away for a time before it is returned. There are two types of suspensions
1 Can I pay by mail?
1 Yes, you can
1 What if the suspension termination fee can be mailed?
1 In that case, you will find instructions on your suspension order
2 Null
3 Do you need to pay more than one definite suspension online?
3 Yes, I have 2
3 You can pay up to 10 suspension termination fees in one day
4 What is a definite suspension?
4 A definite suspension has a clear start and end date. The suspension termination fee for a definite suspension is currently $50, unless the suspension was for violating New York State's zero tolerance alcohol law. The termination fee for the suspension for this crime is $100.
5 Must I pay at a DMV office?
5 Yes, you can pay the suspension termination fee at the office or offices shown on your suspension order

1 What parts of New York are subject to the MCTD fee?
1 The list of counties that are required to pay the MCTD fee include the Bronx, Kings Brooklyn, New York Manhattan, and Queens.
1 So, if I live in one of these counties, I am required to pay the extra fee?
1 Yes, the MCTD fee.
2 I may be moving out of New York in the next few years. Can I get a refund of my licensing fees if I've exchanged my New York driver license for an out of state one?
2 Yes, you can get a refund. You will need to attach a photocopy of your out of state driver license to form MV-215 and mail it to the address on that form. It may take up to 12 weeks to receive the refund.

5 can we stay open if we lose our license?
5 Your facility license enables you to operate in New York State. Complaints filed and charges brought against you can result in the loss of your privilege to operate as a business in New York State.

0 what do we us a mydmv account for?
0 Okay, a MyDMV web account provides registered Users with secure and simplified access to use a variety of DMVs on-line applications and services.
0 Would you like to register for an account?
0 yes, what do I do
0 After you register for an account you will be sent a temporary password by email. You will need the temporary password to complete the on-line registration process.
0 is the account from the DMV or a private place that is providing the service?
0 MyDMV was created by the New York State Department of Motor Vehicles, in cooperation with the New York State Office of Information Technology Services.
0 so I can do my DMV business with the account instead of having to walk in and wait in line?
0 The account will allow you to use a variety of DMVs on-line applications and services.
0 is it secure?
0 Yes,  usernames, passwords, and identity information are stored in a secure directory called the NY.gov, which is maintained by the New York State Office of Information Technology Services.
0 and you give me the first password then I can set my own?
0 Yes, you will be sent a temporary password by email to complete registration. You can then set your own password.

0 A suspension means that your driving license or privilege will be taken from you for a period of time. You may have to pay a suspension termination fee. Your suspension period may be final, having a start and end date, or indefinite, which does not end until you take the required action.

5 I am sorry to inform you that you cannot renew a HazMat endorsement at a DMV office.

0 Deferment might be a good option for you as long as you realize that if you won't have to make a payment, you probably won't be making any progress toward forgiveness or paying back your loan.
0 Are there any alternatives to that option?
0 You could also consider income-driven repayment.
1 Could you please explain to me what that means?
1 Income-driven repayment plans base your monthly payments on your income and family size, meaning that in some cases, you payment under this plan could become as low as $0 per month.
2 Can you tell me about an in-school deferment if I am enrolled in college more than half-time?
2 With that option, in most cases your loan will be placed into a deferment automatically based on enrollment information reported by your school, and your loan servicer will notify you that the deferment has been granted.
3 Are there any extra considerations if I am actually attending school and am active duty military at this time?
3 You may be eligible for this deferment if you are on active duty military service in connection with a war, military operation, or national emergency.
3 If a global pandemic is considered a national emergency, then that does describe my situation.

4 You could complete the Graduate Fellowship Deferment Request if you are enrolled in an approved graduate fellowship program, which is generally a program that provides financial support to graduate students to pursue graduate studies and research.

call_id_564
0 What exactly are program reviews when carried out by Federal Student Aid?
0 Do you mean what duties the FSA have in overseeing their program and the reviewing of it?
0 Yes, that is the question that I have
0 The FSA regularly carries out program reviews which confirms whether a school meets the requirements of the FSA for institutional eligibility, financial responsibility and administrative capability. During these reviews, the school's compliance with FSA requirements is measured. The reviews also assess liabilities for errors in performance that a school may have. Also included in the review is identifying the actions that a school must take to improve its future administrative capabilities.
0 What is the role of the FPRD in these program reviews?
0 When a review is carried out, the FPRD may or may not require additional actions to be carried out by an institution
0 What is a FPRD?
0 This is issued by the FSA. It's a report that includes all the findings that were identified in the program review report, the response from the school in question and also the final determination of the Department
0 Is there a FPRD available for the year 2014?
0 null
0 Where would I be able to find FPRD reports for a school?
0 You can visit the "Third-Party Servicer Program Reviews" page of the website. You can also see an overview of the top program review and audit findings by fiscal year
call_id_565
0 I want to know about reviews on schools and aid
0 Would you like to know about oversight duties in these matters?
0 yeah
0 As part of its oversight duties, Federal Student Aid routinely conducts program reviews to confirm that a school meets the requirements for institutional eligibility, financial responsibility, and administrative capability. During a program review, reviewers evaluate the schools compliance with FSA requirements, assess liabilities for errors in performance, and identify actions the school must take to improve its future administrative capabilities.
0 How do annual reports help?
0 Annual reports detail by frequency the most common findings identified in the annual compliance audits conducted by independent auditors , and identified through program reviews conducted by the Department of Education at institutions of higher education
0 anything else?
0 that's about it
0 what happens after you complete a program review?
0 Federal Student Aid will issue a Final Program Review Determination, which is a report that includes each finding identified in the program review report, the school's response, and the Departments final determination.
0 How can we see some of the reviews?
0 You can visit the "Clery Act Reports" page

call_id_568
0 What are program reviews for federal student aid?
0 Do you want to know about its oversight duties?
0 Yes, what are the oversight duties of the program reviews?
0 FSA conducts program reviews to make sure a school meets FSA requirements for institutional eligibility, financial responsibility, and administrative capability.
0 What happens after completing a program review?
0 The FSA will issue a Final Program Review Determination which is just a report that has each finding identified in the program review report, the school's response, and Department's final determination.
0 What else would the FPRD do?
0 The FPRD will also identify liabilities, calculated based on the findings of the program review, provides instructions for the payment of those liabilities, notifies the institution of its right to appeal and closes the review.

5 Students who have received a subsidized, unsubsidized or PLUS loan under the Direct Loan Program or the FFEL Program must complete exit counseling each time they drop below half-time enrollment, graduate or leave school.

call_id_654
0 Hi, What are the eligibility requirements for a discharge of my student loan if my school closes?
0 If your school closes while you are enrolled with them or soon after you withdraw you may be eligible for discharge of your federal student loan.
1 I have loans with the same school or different programs.  Before I could complete any of the programs my school closed. What happens in a case like this?
1 In a case like yours only loans you received for a program that you were unable to complete because of the school's closure are eligible for discharge.
1 What happens if I enrolled for say Program A but decided not to continue with Program A and then transferred to Program B?
1 In that case as you were unable to complete Program B because the school close only the loans you received for Program B may be discharged.
2 If my school closes which loans are eligible for discharge?
2 Do you have a William D. Ford Federal Direct Loan, a Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) or a Federal Perkins Loan?
2 Yes I have one of those loans.
2 In that case you may be eligible for a 100 percent discharge of your loan if your school closes.
3 My school closes and I need a copy of my academic transcript. Where can I get this?
3 You should contact the state licensing agency in the state where the school was located to find out if the state has the records.

call_id_658
0 What if I can't make my monthly payment?
0 Do you have trouble making your monthly payments?
0 yes
0 Contact your loan manager immediately. Your loan manager can help you understand your options.
1 What steps can I take to avoid non-compliance?
1 Take the time to fully understand your loan agreement and the types of loans you are receiving. It is also important that you do not borrow more than you need or more than you expect to be able to pay
2 If I don't make a payment on time, what happens?
2 Your loan is delinquent and late fees may be charged. Even if you are behind on your loan, you can still avoid default, so it is important that you contact your loan manager immediately.
3 What is simplifying repayment with consolidation?
3 You may want to combine your multiple federal student loans into a single direct consolidation loan to simplify repayment. There may be trade-offs, so understand the advantages and potential disadvantages of consolidation before submitting the application.
4 What steps should I take to successfully repay my federal student loan and avoid default?
4 Understanding your loan agreement, staying on top of your loan information, and making sure to contact your loan servicer if you're having trouble making payments can help you avoid default.

2 Do I still need to look into getting Medicare even I have health insurance through my employer?
2 Yes, you should still check to see if you should sign up with Medicare because once you turn 65, some health insurance plans automatically change.
2 Does this apply if you have health insurance as part of a severance package?
2 Yes, even if you receive health insurance through severage, you should still look into Medicare.
2 Can I file for only one benefit?
2 No, you will be filing for all retirement or spousal benefits.

2 What year does full retirement age begin for age 66?
2 Full retirement age is 66 for people born between 1943 and 1954.  Begining with 1955, two months are added for every birth year until full retirement age reaches 67 for people born in 1960  or later.
2 How much will be deducted if I earn more than the limit under full retirement age?
2 We will subtract $1 from your benefit payments for every $2 you earn over the 2019 limit which $17,640.

0 I wanted to know if only I can see the information on my mySocial Security account. I'm very concerned about my privacy.
0 Yes. Social Security is dedicated to protecting the information and resources entrusted to us, including your personal information and investment. For your protection, you're the only one who can create your personal my Social Security account for your own exclusive use. No one can create or use an account on your behalf, even with written permission.
0 Are you concerned about your protection?
0 No, I trust you. It's alright.
0 Unfortunately, no relevant information is found.
0 But since we already talk about my privacy, I'm not allowed to share my account with someone else, right?
0 Of course. Don't share the use of your account with anyone else under any circumstances, as unauthorized use of this service is a misrepresentation of your identity to the federal government and could subject you to criminal or civil penalties, or both.

1 Yes, that is correct. You will be automatically enrolled as soon as you become eligible.
1 Have you called to speak to a Medicare Customer Service Representative yet?
1 Not yet but I will after this to ask them for more information.
1 Is the phone number ok for you or did you need the TTY number instead?
2 What does TTY number mean? Why would I need that instead?
2 If you are low income, the state must pay your Medicare premiums and possibly other costs.
3 When would my Social Security benefits start?
3 It would begin on the sixth full month after your disability began. For example, if your disability began on June 15th, you would get the first benefit in December.

call_id_782
0 Can you tell me about working while getting retirement benefits?
1 Sure, you know anything about it?
1 Not much, please tell me any relevant information.
1 This means that you can work while receiving Social Security retirement benefits or survivor benefits.
2 I those reasons are fair. May I know if my spouse is eligible for any benefits, including medicare, despite the fact that she did not work under social security. Is this possible?
2 Don't worry, if fact she can. Even if she never worked under SS, she can get benefits if is at least 62 of age and you are already receiving your retirement or disability benefits. In regard of medicare, she can qualify at age 65.
2 So, she can really qualify for those and really have them then?
2 Yeah. As said before, she can enjoy a benefit is she's 62 and you're already receiving a retirement or disability benefit, plus be able to qualify for medicare at 65.
3 Thanks, i just wanted to be sure. Oh, and how much will my spouse receive, given my benefit is higher, please?
3 If you have a higher benefit, your spouse will get an extra amount on your record. In that way. the combination of benefits equals that higher amount.
3 I see, i see, interesting thing. A last question, please. What happens if my spouse begin to receive benefits? There will be some effect?
3 Well, the immediate effect would be that the benefit amount will be permanently reduced by a percentage based on the number of months up to her full retirement age. That applies if she begins to receive benefits between age 62 and her full retirement age.

0 Hello I need information about when to apply for disability benefits
0 You must submit a request as soon as you disable
0 What do you want to request?
0 if I want to request
0 Well among what you can apply for is Social Security, disability benefits will not begin until the sixth full month of disability. The Social Security disability waiting period begins with the first full month after the date we decide your disability began.
1 and where can i apply?
1 You can apply for disability benefits online, or, if you prefer, you can apply for them by calling our toll free number, 1 - 800 - 772 - 1213.
2 And what publications can give me more information about disability benefits?
2 These include the Disability Starter Kit to help you prepare for your disability interview or online application. The kits are available for adults and for children under 18 years of age.
2 and what other information does the kits provide?
2 The kits also provide general information about disability programs and our decision-making process that can help take some of the mystery out of applying for disability benefits.
3 and when do they pay the benefit?
3 SSI Supplemental Security Income, we pay SSI disability benefits for the first full month after the date you filed your claim, or, if later, the date you become eligible for SSI.

call_id_813
0 When should I apply for disability benefits?
0 You should apply as soon as you become disabled.
0 Will you be applying for Social Security disability benefits?
0 Yes, that is what I want to do.
0 You will want to apply as soon as possible. Once approved, it takes until the sixth full month of disability for benefits to begin.
0 Is that the same amount of time that it takes for SSI payments too?
0 For Supplemental Security Income (SSI) payments, they become available on the first full month after you file your claim or the date you become eligible for SSI.
1 How do I apply?
1 You can either apply online, or through our toll-free phone number: 1-800-772-1213.
2 Is there anything I can read that will give me more information? I want to make sure I do this right.
2 Yes, of course. The Disability Starter Kit has all the information you need to help you get ready to apply. There is a kit for adults and a kit for children under age 18.
3 I know you said that SSI gets paid a month after the claim is filed or the date I become eligible, but what if those are two different dates? Which one do they go by?
3 We go by the later of the two dates, which is why it is better to file as soon as possible.

0 I need some help with filling out an application for a disabled child.
1 Do you want to know how to apply for a child then?
1 Yes, exactly that.
1 You will need to complete an Application for Supplemental Security Income SSI AND a Child Disability Report. The report collects information about the child 's disabling condition and how it affects his/her ability to function. At this time, only the Child Disability Report can be completed online.
2 I would like to send my documents by mail, but I have some doubts regarding this, can you help me with them?
2 Is that the only way you can get your documents to us?
2 Yes.
2 If you mail any documents to us remember to include your Social Security number so that the documents can be matched with the correct application. Please do not write anything on the original documents but write your Social Security number on a separate piece of paper and include it with the other documents.

3 Yes, you can estimate your retirement benefits.
4 Is it also possible to withdraw my application?
4 Of course. Sometimes, life changes occur after you submit your application. You have up to 12 months to withdraw your application, if you change your mind. You will be required to repay any benefits you've already received.

4 Well, so how do I keep my information safe?
4 Identity theft affects millions of people each year and can cause serious financial and identity-related problems. Protect yourself by securing your personal information, taking the time to understand the threat of identity theft, and exercising caution.

call_id_833
0 There are several things that I need explained about medicare premiums. Perhaps you can help me?
0 Of course. The law requires an adjustment to your monthly Medicare Part B medical insurance and Medicare prescription drug coverage premiums. This affects less than five percent of people with Medicare. Most people don t pay higher premiums.
1 What role does my tax return play in this?
1 Do you want to know how we determine your 2020 income-related monthly adjustment amounts?
1 Sure. Go ahead.
1 We use your most recent federal tax return the IRS provides to us. Generally, his information is from a tax return filed in 2019 for tax year 2018. Sometimes, the IRS only provides information from a return filed in 2018 for tax year 2017.
2 Can you tell me on what documents should I submit to Social Security as proof of my identity?
2 They need to verify your identity through id's like a driver's license or a state issued non-driver id card.

3 Yes, you can apply for a replacement card online.
4 Will I need to prove or verify my citizenship to obtain a social security card?
4 Yes, you must have valid documentation that proves your citizenship in order to apply for a social security card.
call_id_834
0 what can you tell me about Medicare Premiums: Rules For Higher-Income Beneficiaries
0 The law requires an adjustment to your monthly Medicare Part B medical insurance and Medicare prescription drug coverage premiums . This affects less than five percent of people with Medicare . Most people don t pay higher premiums
1 How Social Security Determines I Have a Higher Premium
1 Social Security uses the most recent federal tax return the IRS provides to us .
1 you must pay higher premiums
1 yes
1 we use a sliding scale to calculate the adjustments , based on your modified adjusted gross income MAGI . Your MAGI is your total adjusted gross income and tax - exempt interest income .
2 If I want to get more information regarding my Medicare, how can I contact the State Health Insurance Counseling and Assistance Program?
2 You can find your local SHIP contact information in the back of your Medicare & You 2020 Handbook online
3 I'd like to ask you another question about having a higher income. If I am a higher-income Medicare beneficiary with prescription drug coverage ?
3 you ll pay monthly premiums plus an additional amount , which is based on what you report to the IRS . Because individual plan premiums vary , the law specifies that the amount is determined using a base premium .
4 if I income isn t greater than the limits described above
4  this law does not apply to you
5  If I have higher income
5 you ll pay an additional premium amount for Medicare Part B and Medicare prescription drug coverage . We call the additional amount the income - related monthly adjustment amount

call_id_838
0 I have some questions regarding my social security credits and could use some help with that.
0 Of course. You must earn at least 40 Social Security credits to qualify for Social Security benefits. You earn Social Security credits when you work and pay Social Security taxes.
0 Wait, does this mean I get more money if I have more credits?
0 The number of credits does not affect the amount of benefits you receive.
0 So I don't get more if I have more credits?
0 No, credits only determine if you are eligible or not. You do not get extra benefits for earning more than the minimum number of credits.
0 Could you explain to me on what is included in the Supplemental Security Income?
0 The Supplemental Security Income or SSI program pay benefits to disabled adults and children who have low income.
0 What if I have worked a longer period of time?
0 Someone who has worked long enough may also be able to receive Social Security disability or retirement benefits as well as SSI.
0 Could someone the age of 65 and over without disabilities get SSI benefits?
0 Yes, if you are age 65 or older and not have a disability you could get SSI if you meet the financial limits.

4 Do it online. Fill out a Dependents Application for VA Education Benefits VA Form 22-5490 and send it to the VA regional benefit office where you want to go to school.

0 Hello I need information about what to expect at my Board hearing
1 Do you want to know specifically what will happen to your audience?
1 do not
2 Do you want to know when the judge will make a decision on your appeal?
2 Yes
2 Your hearing will be transcribed and added to your appeal file. You will be asked if you want a copy of the transcript for your personal records. The judge will review the hearing and other evidence in your appeal file before making a decision.
2 Do you know how long you can present new evidence to your case?
2 do not
2 Do you have new evidence to present?
2 Yes
2 Good in the event that you have new evidence to present, it will take 90 days. If you don't have new evidence to present, you can waive the 90-day period that is automatically added to your appeal. Some Veterans Service Organizations will ask for time to present additional arguments in support of your case, so please contact your representative first if you are considering waiving this time period.
3 ok, and can I reschedule or withdraw my Board hearing request?
4 you want to know What if you need to reschedule your audience?
4 Yes
4 You must send a written request to the Veterans Appeals Board with good reason to reschedule your hearing at least 2 weeks before your hearing. Include your name, the VA file number for your appeal, and the reason you need a new hearing date. Submit your request in writing to the Board.

call_id_905
0 Hello I need information about the VA duty to help
0 Of course I would love to help you. VA's duty to help requires VA to help you obtain evidence, such as medical records, that is necessary to support your case. VA s The duty to help applies during your initial claim and if you file a supplemental claim.
0 What happens if I request a Higher Level Review or a Board Appeal?
0 The duty to help does not apply. However, the reviewer or judge will review whether VA fulfilled its duty to assist during your initial or supplemental claim.
1 But I have a particular circumstance, in my case I do not agree with a VA decision that I received in January 2019, what can I do in that case?
1 If you disagree with a VA decision you received before February 19, 2019, you can opt for the modernized review system after receiving a VA Statement from the SOC on the case or a Supplemental Statement from the SSOC on the case.

5 Does my VA health care meet the ACA's minimum essential coverage requirement for 2018?
5 If you were signed up for one of the designated programs listed on the website, your health coverage meets the minimum requirement for 2018
5 What are these designated health care programs?
5 Yes, I am
5 In that case, you don't have to pay any fee when you file your 2018 taxes and to qualify, you must be enrolled on one the programs that are listed on the website
6 Is there a penalty applicable if I don't have health insurance?
6 Until the end of 2018, the ACA required that all US taxpayers had to have health insurance that met a minimum standard. Some taxpayers are eligible for exemptions from this due to certain life events, financial status or other factors. If you had affordable health care options open to you and you chose not to avail of health insurance, then you would have to pay a fee when filing your taxes
6 What happens if I didn't have health coverage in 2018 or have an exemption?
6 In this instance, you may still have to pay a fee to file your taxes in April 2019. To find out more, I will refer you to HealthCare.gov to find out more about exemptions

5 Who will do the exam for the VA claim?
5 A VA doctor or a non-VA doctor who we contracted with will do your exam; but you may have your own doctor examine you and fill out the proper forms.

1 Is there a vehicle use tax?
1 Residents of New York City and several counties in New York must pay a vehicle use tax when they register a commercial vehicle or renew a commercial vehicle registration.
2 How much is the vehicle use tax?
2 Vehicle use tax is $40 a year and livery and for-hire vehicles in these registration classes are $400 for 1 year.
3 What about taxes outside of New York City?
3 The chart show the use taxes and supplemental fees for all original registrations and renewals.  The amount of the sales tax depends on the purchase price and your locality.

2 Are there restrictions on where I can drive when I have a learner's permit?
2 Yes certainly. You may not drive with a learner permit on any street within a park in New York City or on any bridge or tunnel under the jurisdiction of the Tri-borough Bridge and Tunnel Authority.
3 Can I ride with someone else if I'm driving a moped?
3 No unfortunately the only passenger who can ride with you on the moped is your supervising driver.
4 What are the rules for driving with someone who is supervising me?
4 You may not drive unless accompanied by a supervising driver age 21 or older who has a valid license to operate the vehicle you are driving. So only a person with a motorcycle license may supervise a person learning to drive a motorcycle
5 And if I'm learning to ride a motorcycle, what then?
5 In that case, your supervising driver must exercise general supervision of you while you operate the motorcycle and remain within one - quarter mile of you at all times.
5 And can he ride with me?
5 Yes but only your supervising driver is the only person who can ride with you.
6 And I can't go through Central Park?
6 No the rule is that you may not drive with a learner permits on any street within a park in New York City.

0 Unfortunately, no relevant information is found.
1 What about if the course is cancelled by the sponsor? Do I get a refund then?
1 Yes, if the course is cancelled, they must offer you a full refund. In some cases, the sponsor may offer the option of rescheduling the course at a later date.
2 How do you pay for the I-PIRP course?
2 Normally, the sponsor will require you to pay by credit card. However, the payment type will vary by sponsor, so it's best to check with him/her for that information.
3 Okay. Let's go back to my original question. Do I get a refund if I fail the course?
3 No. You will not receive credit for course completion or point and insurance reduction for the course. You may be offered to retake the course for no additional costs, but that is up to the sponsor.
4 What equipment do I need for a DVD ADM course?
4 You will need a tv and a dvd player. If any additional technology is required, the sponsors must provide this for you.
5 How much does a I-PIRP course usually cost?
5 The fee for the course is set by the sponsor, so it will vary from course to course. The cost must be stated clearly before you register, so be sure to compare courses and their fees to get the best value.

4 Where can I see if my vehicle is flood damaged?

0 Were you unable to keep your insurance while on active duty?
0 yes, it just wasn't on my mind and I don't get notices and anything like that while deployed
0 DMV has a procedure in place to exempt you from administrative actions upon your return. You must provide a notarized statement that the vehicle was not used during the time in question, a copy of your military ID, proof of current insurance  or surrender of plates, and signed and dated copies of deployment and return papers, or DD-214. You can present these documents at any DMV office , or mail them to us.

1 and what do I do if my license expired while I was deployed?
1 You can renew your license if it was valid at any time during your military service. Active military personnel will have to show proof of date of entry into military service
2 is anything being done to help us when this happens?
2 Yes, pursuant to Executive Order No. 2 by Governor Andrew M. Cuomo, all licenses and registrations for New York State military personnel returning from active military duty relating to the war on terrorism and military action in Iraq will automatically be extended.
3 how much time do I have to renew my license after it expired?
3 Discharged or separated military personnel may renew an expired NY State license up to two years after the extended expiration. No more than 30 months may have passed since discharge

2 In the next few years, I could leave New York. Is it possible to get a refund of my licensing fees if I move from a New York driver license to one from another state?
2 Yes, you can get a refund. You will need to attach a photocopy of your out of state driver license to form MV-215 and mail it to the address on that form. It may take up to 12 weeks to receive the refund.

5 You need to change your address online then renew. There is no guarantee that the US Postal Service will forward your DMV documents to your new address

1 Yes, I am.

1 In that case you can have the word "Veteran" printed on the upper left hand of your photo document.
2 Ah, that's good to know. Say, what if my temporary visitor status has been extended?
2 Then you must go to a DMV office with your updated paperwork from the United States Department of Homeland Security DHS. We will update our records to show that your Temporary Visitor status has been extended so you can renew your license. Your new license will have your new temporary visitor expiration date.
3 What are the various lifetime sporting.recreational license privileges or credentials that can be added to my DMV issued photo document?
3 You are able to add icons for lifetime licenses such as Sportsman, Boating Safety, Small/Big Game, Fishing, Bow Hunting, Muzzle Loading, Trapping, and Empire Passport.
4 What if I decide later on I want the icons removed?
4 You can contact the agency Parks or DEC that issued the lifetime license, privilege or credential request to notify the DMV to remove the icons and there is no fee to do so.

1 and what regulations exist for the driver's license?

call_id_1128
0 I want to become a driving school instructor and need to know what tests are involved in the process.
0 First, you will need to pass a vision test similar to the one you need to complete in order to qualify or renew your driver license. This can be conducted at the DMV or you can have your eye doctor/physician conduct the test for you and have him/her complete the Vision Test Report.
0 Are you aware of what will happen if you do not pass all the required tests?
0 Yes, I know.
0 Okay. In addition to submitting a new application, you will be charged a $10 fee.
1 What is required to become a driving school instructor?
1 You must have a New York driver license that has been valid for at least 2 years in the class of vehicle that you intend to teach in. You must also have an acceptable driving record and your license cannot be suspended or revoked in the last 2 years.
2 What is the name of the form that my eye doctor needs to fill out for the vision test?
2 It's called the Vision Test Report form MV-619.
3 Does my license have to be valid for 2 years since completing the application or after I get my instructor license?
3 Your license must be valid for at least 2 years after you complete the application.
4 What if I have a driver license that was issued in another state?
4 When you complete your application, you will need to include a certified copy of your driving record from the state agency that issued your driver license.
5 What is a driving school instructor expected to do?
5 Once you become a certified driving school instructor, you will be teaching individuals how to drive a vehicle at a licensed driving school.

2 I'd like to know on how much is the cost for a penalty that was imposed on March 22, 1995?
2 In that case the civil penalty is $ 500.
3 I got it. Another question about the civil penalty I think the price is somewhat high. I understand. Is there a way to find out if my license is revoked?
3 Of course. Simply sign up for MyDMV and use the My License, Permit or ID service. A driving privilege is your legal authority to drive in a state other than the state that issued your driver license.
4 I wanna ask if I can drive outside NY using my junior learner permit?? I wanna do a road trip.
4 You may drive outside New York State with your NY State junior learner permit or junior driver license if it is allowed by the laws of the other state. You must obey the junior permit and license restrictions that apply in that state. Check with the police or motor vehicle authorities in the state you will visit.
5 I'd like to know where I can find out if my license has been suspended or revoked.
5 Sign up for MyDMV and use the My License, Permit or ID [2] service. A driving privilege is your legal authority to drive in a state other than the state that issued your driver license. If you have a driver license issued in another state , DMV can revoke your privilege to drive in New York State , but your out of state license may still be valid to drive in other states. What if I was suspended due to a lapse in my insurance?
5 Do you have more information, perhaps?
5 For more information, see the section for alcohol or drug related violations on our website.
5 Got that. Just out of curiosity, how could I remove a suspension for the failure of paying child support?
5 To do that you must contact the local child support enforcement agency or the NY State Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance OTDA. The OTDA website has a list of local child support enforcement agencies.
call_id_1176
0 I have some questions regarding a suspended driving privilege. Perhaps you can answer some or even all of them.
0 Of course. A suspension means your license or driving privilege will be taken away for a period of time. You may need to pay a suspension termination fee. Your suspension period can be definite which has a beginning and end date or indefinite, which does not end until you take a required action.
1 That's good to know. What can you tell me about definite suspensions?
1 Have you received a definite suspension?
1 Yes, I have. Hence the questions.
1 In that case it will tell you how long the suspension period will last. You can not drive until the period ends, you pay a termination fee, and have a valid driver license again. You can use DMV's My License, Permit or ID service to check if your license is valid.
2 Okay, that's it. I'm also curious about Driver Restriction. Do I have to have them installed on all of my vehicles?
2 Yes, they have to be installed on all vehicles you own or operate.
2 What happens if I drive without it?
2 Your license will be revoked.
2 In all cases, or are there exceptions?
2 It will be revoked.
3 What happens if I have the problem driver restriction and I get a moving violation?
3 Approval for your license/permit can be withdrawn.

0 Deferment might be a good option for you as long as you realize that if you won't have to make a payment, you probably won't be making any progress toward forgiveness or paying back your loan.
0 Are there any alternatives to that option?
0 You could also consider income-driven repayment.
1 Could you please explain to me what that means?
1 Income-driven repayment plans base your monthly payments on your income and family size, meaning that in some cases, you payment under this plan could become as low as $0 per month.
2 Can you tell me about an in-school deferment if I am enrolled in college more than half-time?
2 With that option, in most cases your loan will be placed into a deferment automatically based on enrollment information reported by your school, and your loan servicer will notify you that the deferment has been granted.

3 Unpaid interest is capitalized and the total amount you repay over the life of your loan may be higher
4 what is discretionary forbearance?
4 Your loan servicer decides whether to grant a request for a general forbearance. For this reason a general forbearance is sometimes called a discretionary forbearance.

call_id_1225
0 What exactly are program reviews when carried out by Federal Student Aid?
0 Do you mean what duties the FSA have in overseeing their program and the reviewing of it?
0 Yes, that is the question that I have
0 The FSA regularly carries out program reviews which confirms whether a school meets the requirements of the FSA for institutional eligibility, financial responsibility and administrative capability. During these reviews, the school's compliance with FSA requirements is measured. The reviews also assess liabilities for errors in performance that a school may have. Also included in the review is identifying the actions that a school must take to improve its future administrative capabilities.
1 I'd like to learn more about FAFSA4caster as well. Is it suitable for older students?
1 Yes, adult students also can use FAFSA4caster
1 what about freshmen?
1 Yes, they can use it. FAFSA4caster is a helpful tool for anyone who is not yet ready to submit a FAFSA form it is recommended for high school juniors , and even as early as middle school
1 can our parents use it since they will help pay for school?
1 Yes, they can use it to receive early estimates, create scenarios based on future earnings, and then establish college funding strategies
2 so you will ask a lot of financial stuff?
2 You will answer financial questions and some may ask you about your federal tax information or your bank statements
call_id_1226
0 I want to know about reviews on schools and aid
0 Would you like to know about oversight duties in these matters?
0 yeah
0 As part of its oversight duties, Federal Student Aid routinely conducts program reviews to confirm that a school meets the requirements for institutional eligibility, financial responsibility, and administrative capability. During a program review, reviewers evaluate the schools compliance with FSA requirements, assess liabilities for errors in performance, and identify actions the school must take to improve its future administrative capabilities.
0 How do annual reports help?
0 Annual reports detail by frequency the most common findings identified in the annual compliance audits conducted by independent auditors , and identified through program reviews conducted by the Department of Education at institutions of higher education
1 One more thing for FAFSA Completion Data. Is there a reason why the number of older students at our school is so low?
1 We try to identify students that are likely seniors in high school. Most of the older students would likely not satisfy the age criteria requiring applicants to be less than 20 years of age at the cutoff date when we collect data.
2 why would a district be listed as having insufficient data?
2 Did the district in question merge or is it a new district created after 2009-10 ?
2 it was created after 2010
2 The district would be listed as having insufficient data.
3 ok, also why are numbers different from year to year for the same data on seniors?
3 It probably comes from applicants that had applied in a previous year and weren't listed again

0 these determinations are issued every year from FY2014 onwards

1 Take the time to fully understand your loan agreement and the types of loans you are receiving. It is also important that you do not borrow more than you need or more than you expect to be able to pay
2 If I don't make a payment on time, what happens?
2 Your loan is delinquent and late fees may be charged. Even if you are behind on your loan, you can still avoid default, so it is important that you contact your loan manager immediately.
3 What is simplifying repayment with consolidation?
3 You may want to combine your multiple federal student loans into a single direct consolidation loan to simplify repayment. There may be trade-offs, so understand the advantages and potential disadvantages of consolidation before submitting the application.
4 What steps should I take to successfully repay my federal student loan and avoid default?
4 Understanding your loan agreement, staying on top of your loan information, and making sure to contact your loan servicer if you're having trouble making payments can help you avoid default.
