call_id_1233
0 What Program Reviews does federal student aid routinely do?
0 Do you mean as part of their oversight duties?
0 No that is not what I mean.
0 Unfortunately, no relevant information is found.
0 Does federal student aid issue a final report of the determination of the program review?
0 Yes, Federal Student Aid issues a Final Program Review Determination which is the report that has each finding identified in the review report, the school's response, and the Departments final determination.
0 How do I locate Final Program Review Determinations from completed third-party servicer program reviews?
0 You would need to visit the "third-party Servicer Program Reviews page.
0 What happens after completing the program review?
0 Federal Student Aid will issue a Final Program Review Determination which is a report that includes each finding identified in the program review report, school's response to the findings, and the Department's final determination.
0 What else does the FPRD do?
0 The FPRD identifies liabilities if there are any and they are calculated based on the findings of the program review; provides instruction for the payment of those liabilities; notifies them of its right to appeal the amount of liabilities as appropriate; and closes the program review.

0 I'd also like to learn more about Program Reviews. What is the FPRD's role in these program reviews?
0 When a review is carried out, the FPRD may or may not require additional actions to be carried out by an institution
0 What is a FPRD?
0 This is issued by the FSA. It's a report that includes all the findings that were identified in the program review report, the response from the school in question and also the final determination of the Department
0 Is there a FPRD available for the year 2014?
0 null
0 Where would I be able to find FPRD reports for a school?
0 You can visit the "Third-Party Servicer Program Reviews" page of the website. You can also see an overview of the top program review and audit findings by fiscal year

0 What if I can't make my monthly payment?
0 Do you have trouble making your monthly payments?
0 yes
0 Contact your loan manager immediately. Your loan manager can help you understand your options.
1 In addition, I need to know what the Final Program Review Determination, What happens after a program analysis is completed?
1 The FSA will issue a Final Program Review Determination which is just a report that has each finding identified in the program review report, the school's response, and Department's final determination.
1 What else would the FPRD do?
1 The FPRD will also identify liabilities, calculated based on the findings of the program review, provides instructions for the payment of those liabilities, notifies the institution of its right to appeal and closes the review.
1 Where would I find an overview of the top program review and audit findings by fiscal year?
1 To find an overview of the top program review and audit findings by fiscal year you should visit the "third party servicer program reviews."
1 Is there a fiscal year 2014?
1 Yes, there is a fiscal year 2014.

1 What happens if my obligation to pay my loans is reinstated?
1 In that case Nelnet will explain the reason for the reinstallation and provide you with information on what you can do if you have questions about the reinstallation or if you believe the reset was based on incorrect information.
2 What actions do they take If they determine that I am totally or permanently disabled as per the documentation of the SSA or the certification of a doctor?
2 The first thing is to notify you that your loans or TEACH Grant service obligation have been canceled;
3 If my loan is canceled due to TPD, do I have to pay taxes on the amount of the canceled loan?
3 In this case, if you received a TPD discharge of a loan before January 1, 2018, the amount of the loan written off can be considered income for federal tax purposes under the IRS rules of the Internal Revenue Service.
4 So what benefit does a TPD download generate due to total and permanent disability?
4 frees you from having to pay a loan from the Direct Loan Program
call_id_1321
0 If I am totally and permanently disabled, can I qualify for a discharge of my federal student loans?
0 Note a TPD discharge for total and permanent disability frees you from having to pay a loan from the William D. Ford Federal Direct Loan Direct Loan Program, a loan from the FFEL Federal Family Education Loan Program and / or a Loan Federal Perkins or complete an EDUCATION Grant service obligation.
0 How can I qualify for a TPD download?
0 You must first complete and submit a TPD download request, along with documentation showing that you meet our requirements to be considered totally and permanently disabled, to Nelnet, the administrator who assists the US Department of Education with the process TPD download.
1 If you show that I am totally and permanently disabled according to the SSA documentation, it means that you are subject to a monitoring period of three years after discharge, what else should I know?
1 you must be considered discharged for federal tax purposes at the end of the post-discharge monitoring period
2 I'm a certified teacher, and I'm curious if my federal student loans will be forgiven because of my work as a teacher.
2 If you teach full-time and meet all the other qualifications you may be eligible for forgiveness of up to $17,500 on your student loan.
2 I have a Direct Consolidation Loan, does this qualify?
2 Yes, you may be eligible for forgiveness of the outstanding portion of the consolidation loan that repaid an eligible Direct Subsidized Loan, Direct Unsubsidized Loan, Subsidized or Unsubsidized Federal Stafford Loan.
3 At what time after I qualify can I apply for teacher loan forgiveness?
3 You can apply once you have completed the required five consecutive years of qualifying teaching.
